main event: A civilian observer spotted multiple bright lights moving at high speeds and maneuvering in the sky near Columbus, Indiana on December 6, 1953.
interesting points: The objects were described as a circular ring of smoke that appeared to be under controlled movement and able to maneuver without any visible means of propulsion.
The objects were estimated to be about 30-35 feet in diameter and flew in a straight line, following each other slightly below and to the right of the lead object.
The objects did not produce any sound that could be heard by the observers on the ground.
A Civil Air Patrol officer also reported observing a similar object, estimated to be about 2 feet in diameter, traveling at around 700 mph and maintaining a steady course and altitude.
Two additional witnesses, a pilot, co-pilot, and navigator, confirmed the Civil Air Patrol officer's report.
sighted object: circular ring of smoke, 2 ft diameter object
witnesses: civilians, Civil Air Patrol officer, pilot, co-pilot, navigator
